main event: A civilian witness reported seeing a bright, brilliant, oblong object moving erratically in the night sky over Maple Heights, Ohio on September 8, 1959. The object appeared to disappear and reappear, and the witness reported the incident to authorities.
interesting points: The witness observed the object moving somewhat erratically and disappearing as though it had gone behind a tree, then reappearing a short time later.
The witness, along with Robert M. Cleveland, reported the sighting to authorities.
The conclusion of the report listed possibilities such as a balloon, aircraft, or insufficient data for evaluation, leaving the sighting unexplained.

The witness estimated the object to be about the size of an auto radiator, called attention to the writer, and remained motionless for about 10 minutes before rising straight up at a very high rate of speed and disappearing from sight within 2 to 3 minutes.
The U.S. Air Force requested the witness complete a questionnaire in regard to the sighting and return it for further analysis and evaluation, showing official interest in the event.
sighted object: bright, brilliant, oblong object moving erratically in the night sky
